p:
We determined the most important variables for climatic suitability of IPS using the Jackknife test in Maxent ( Papeş & Gaubert, 2007; Phillips & Dudík, 2008; Merow, Smith & Silander, 2013). Then, we extracted the average value of the climatic variable from the Jackknife test, which is the most important to the climatic suitability of IPS in each ecoregion. We used the following equation to compute the changes of important climate variables in each ecoregion:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}$${\rm{C}}{{\rm{V}}_n} = V_n^f-V_n^c$$\end{document}
CV
n
=
V n f
−
V n c
where CV
n is the change of important climate variables in the ecoregion n; V
j
f and V
n
c are the future and current climate variables in ecoregion n, respectively.
